Title: How to Play Up Your Eyes

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of using the right colors for different skin tones
Content.Text: The light color goes all over the lid, the medium color goes from the lash line three-quarters of the way up, and the darkest color is used as liner only.

Content.Knowledge Point: The different formulas and tools for applying eyeshadow
Content.Text: You can use powder, pencil, gel, or a wand, depending on what's easiest for you. Different tools and formulas are available for different effects.

Content.Knowledge Point: Creating a natural-looking eye makeup look
Content.Text: It's important to create a look that fits your face. Use light, medium, and dark colors, and blend them well to achieve a natural effect.

Content.Knowledge Point: Applying eyeliner and mascara for eye definition
Content.Text: Eyeliner and mascara are key to defining the eyes. Use a light color all over the lid, a medium color on the lid, and the darkest color as liner only.
Mascara should be black and applied in thin coats to open up the eyes. Use a spoolie to separate lashes and curl them after applying mascara.
Fill in the eyebrows using shadow or a pencil, brushing up to create an arch and going down to frame the eye. Soften the edges with powder or a spoolie.
